S

setCellState(T, int) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Sets the state of the given cell to the given state.
setRule(Rule<T>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation
This method allows for on-the-fly switching with rules, as well as setting the initial rule.
setRule(Rule<Point1D>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation1D
Changes the rule to the new rule specified by r.
setRule(Rule<Point2D>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation2D
Changes the rule to the new rule specified by r.
setSize(T) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Sets the size of the state to the given size.
setState(HashMap<T, Integer>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Sets the state based on a mapping between T and states (stored as integers).
setViewport(Viewport<T>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation
Allows you to swap Viewports of the program out.
setVisualization(Visualization) - Method in interface cellularAutomata.interfaces.Viewport
The Viewport uses the given Visualization to determine what colors each cell should be.
setVisualization(Visualization) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation
Allows you to swap out a Visualization (color picker)
setWrap(int, boolean) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Sets whether axis number dimension wraps around or not
setWraps(boolean[]) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Allows you to set whether each axis wraps all at once.
Simulation<T extends Point> - Class in cellularAutomata.lib
Defines a simulation for a cellular automaton.
Simulation1D - Class in cellularAutomata.lib
Gives a concrete simulation for 1 dimensional cellular automata.
Simulation1D(Rule<Point1D>, Visualization) - Constructor for class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation1D
Constructs a Simulation for a given ruleset and visualization using the default Viewport
Simulation2D - Class in cellularAutomata.lib
A concrete implementation of a 2 dimensional simulation.
Simulation2D(Rule<Point2D>, Visualization) - Constructor for class cellularAutomata.lib.Simulation2D
Constructs a Simulation2D with the given rule and visualization.
State<T extends Point> - Class in cellularAutomata.lib
Represents a state of a cellular automaton, supporting an arbitrary number of dimensions.
State(T, int) - Constructor for class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Creates a new State with default no wrapping
State(T, int, boolean[]) - Constructor for class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Creates a new State with wrapping as specified by the boolean array.
State(T, int, boolean[], HashMap<T, Integer>) - Constructor for class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Creates a new State with wrapping as specified by the boolean array, and the given initial state.
step(Rule<T>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.lib.State
Steps the world once based on the rules specified in r
stepCell(Neighborhood<T>) - Method in interface cellularAutomata.interfaces.Rule
The primary function of the rule that takes a neighborhood of size specified by the user in getNeighborhoodSize(), and returns a new state that the center of the neighborhood n should step to.
stepCell(Neighborhood<Point2D>) - Method in class cellularAutomata.plugin.LifeRule
